message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.AL, cs.CG

Reasoning: The paper deals with the algorithmic problems of routing traffic through a sequence of waypoints in computer networks. This topic is closely related to network architecture and design, which falls under the category of computer networks (cs.NI). The paper also establishes connections to classic graph theoretical problems, indicating a strong focus on graph algorithms and data structures (cs.DS). The combinatorial structure of the problem suggests a connection to discrete mathematics (cs.DM), while the complexity analysis and derivation of NP-hardness results indicate a focus on algorithmic complexity (cs.AL). Finally, the problem of routing traffic through a sequence of waypoints can be seen as a geometric problem in a network, which suggests a connection to computational geometry (cs.CG).
